Mobility creep is a form of power creep. Power creep refers to instances where newly released contents of a preexisting game is more powerful than previous ones, so that the new content will be used. This is fine in games like WoW where getting better gear is an important aspect of the game, but in League, where all champion picks should be balanced (more or less), having an objectively more powerful champion means that an older champion is outclassed.

So mobility creep basically means the new releases keep getting more mobility and warp the game around it. For example, Teemo was considered one of the most mobile champions in the game at one point, but now he's on the immobile side of the roster.

And Annie ultimate counters mobility creep because no matter how mobile you are, you can't dodge an instant cast spell (that is usually combined with the stun). If you're stunned, you lose all advantages of being mobile to dodge spells, and just get bursted down.

I agree with this, though I think Annie's ult could also be improved by having its range increased. Her initiation is still dysfunctional without Flash, but it needs to be, because otherwise she could simply burst anyone down on demand. If her ult had a delay, she could potentially throw Tibbers from much farther away, which would allow her to start her burst combo without needing a gapcloser, but would also make her more competitively valuable, since one of Annie's greatest strengths is her ability to nuke and stun the entire enemy team at once. She might need a few more changes after that (her E is still a boring ability that's mostly only used to generate stacks), but a change like that could significantly improve both her counterplay and her agency.

No, she does not need it and Riot already commented on that concept and the concept of losing her stun stacks.

Beluga Whale: 

"Things we especially like:

The flash bear drop. Annie’s bread-and-butter burst combo is a threatening affair that’s more about skirting the edges of Annie’s range than dodging a skillshot. While League benefits a lot from the potential to outplay most abilities in the game, having Champions with reliable abilities is also good for the game as long as they don’t make less-reliable champions obsolete."

AND

"The delay on Tibber's spawn is so short that we don't believe it falls within the window of "dodge this ability". If you predict it and jump out of the way, that's great! But a pre-indicator could send the wrong message of "we expect you to be able to get out of this".

His response about having her stacks delay or fall off:

"This is a neat idea, but it has a few issues:

Most other champions with their Ultimates ready already put out the pressure that they could use it at any time
This would make roaming or hiding in ambush with Annie a matter of spamming abilities constantly unless the decay time was trivial and it would just get reset in the lane pressure situation."
